summary: This document is a chain of emails from April 26, 2019, between U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) personnel discussing updates on the Epstein case. The emails focus on preparing a memo for a meeting with Brad Weinsheimer, incorporating information about the Florida victims litigation and the CVRA suit, and seeking clarification on a victim's identity.

persons.name: Brad Weinsheimer
persons.context: A DOJ official with whom a meeting is scheduled to discuss updates on the Epstein case.

events.title: Scheduled meeting with Brad Weinsheimer
events.description: A meeting is scheduled for Monday, April 29, 2019, between a U.S. Attorney's Office representative and Brad Weinsheimer to discuss the Epstein case.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was actively preparing updates on the Epstein case in April 2019.
The office was seeking to incorporate information about the Florida victims litigation and the Crime Victims' Rights Act (CVRA) suit into their briefing materials.
There was a specific request for the first name or last initial of an individual referred to as 'Victim-3'.
The communication indicates coordination within the office to brief a DOJ official (Brad Weinsheimer) on the status of the investigation.
